attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
Think about what you eat when you eat out on average during the week. Is it sausages, pizza, poutine? Don't you think it's time to spice up your palate, both figuratively and literally? There is a cuisine that has a long standing history in time and hasn't changed a whole lot since then. 'Why hasn't it changed?' you might be asking. That's because the food is as good now as it was then, and there isn't a need for change. The taste speaks for itself.

We're talking of course about the flavors and dishes of the Lebanon and the Mediterranean. We are Jerusalem Grill, and we are located in Surrey, British Columbia. We here at Jerusalem Grill have two things in mind every day: our food, and our customers. You are the reason we make sure to do our best in everything each and every day. We value local and organic farms and partner with them because of their commitment to use sustainable methods of raising food and animals, as well as their commitment to give us the best, freshest, and most delicious ingredients that this side of Surrey has to offer. We want to be the bridge between the farm and your table, and we want you to enjoy the wholesome tastes the Lebanon and the Mediterranean has to offer.

Something we learned right away in all our years of running this restaurant is that no two guests at our tables are the same...

attributes.about_this_biz_history: In 1958, two brothers borrowed $600 from their mom to open a pizza place in Wichita, Kansas. They named it Pizza Hut because their sign only had room for eight letters. How profound! Soon, the restaurant grew. Why? The pizza was awesome. The service felt like home. And the customers were treated like family. And we've been delivering that same food and service ever since. For the Love of Pizza Since 1958. From day one, the Carney brothers could look their customers in the eye and promise them the finest pizza in town -- because they knew the farmers who grew the ingredients, and they knew those farmers cared about quality. Since then, our farmers have grown right alongside us, and the ingredients we use are still our highest priority. No one loves pizza more than Pizza Hut. That's why pizza is in our name -- and always will be.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
Your Place to Connect
To wave is a simple gesture which invites connection.
When was the last time you genuinely connected with something or someone? Chances are it was far too long ago. We set out to create a place where friends, family, and strangers could feel good coming together as a community. Waves Coffee invites you to connect with each other, a good cup of coffee, or something you've long forgotten. This is the sentiment and the origin behind our name.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Founded in 2005 at Hastings and Richards Street in downtown Vancouver, Waves has been blazing the trail for with superbly fresh brewed coffee, a commitment to local craftsmanship and community, and incomparable service.
In 2008, we were recognized by the Brand Coaches as the Hottest Brand in Canada. We have also been recognized as the Best of Brands by over 1,500 coffee retailers.
Today there are 38 Waves across British Columbia and Alberta and with more to come you'll be sure to ride the Waves with us sometime soon!
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
Your Place to Connect
To wave is a simple gesture which invites connection.
When was the last time you genuinely connected with something or someone? Chances are it was far too long ago. We set out to create a place where friends, family, and strangers could feel good coming together as a community. name: Ban Chok Dee Thai Cuisine-Maple Ridge

about_this_biz_business_recommendation.description: Our other (original) location in Langley, BC!

attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
Owner and Executive Chef, Parinya, has been cooking Thai food from a very young age when she preapared meals for her family in Thailand and sold hot food on the street in front of her house. She has a passion and talent for Thai food, arts and culture and enjoyed sharing this with her friends and family. And now, she is able to share this passion with her customers at Ban Chok Dee Thai Cuisine. She can be seen running between the kitchen and the customers to make sure everything is just right!

She enjoys cooking, fruit and vegetable carving, decorating and flower arrangements, and loves to share these skills with others, whether it is through the dining experience at the restaurant; catering for a wedding or party; or directly through the cooking and carving classes that she offers.

In addition to Parinya, our current chefs all bring many years of experience cooking in the restaurants of Thailand and share Parinya's passion for food.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Ban Chok Dee Thai Cuisine opened in the summer of 2009 and is locally owned and operated. The owner, Parinya, moved to Canada from Thailand in 1998 and is committed to providing authentic, great tasting Thai food with traditional & friendly Thai service.

Starting out on 203 Street in Langley with 5 staff, we moved a new location on Douglas Crescent in Langley in the summer of 2012 and now have around 15 employees and seating for up to 120 guests.

In June 2016, we opened up a 2nd location in Maple Ridge offering the same great food and services.

We have been voted one of the Best Thai Restaurants in Langley since 2011 by the readers of the Langley Times and Langley Advance, and we were the first restaurant in Langley to have been awarded the Thai Select designation which is determined by the Thailand Department of International Trade Promotion.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: We offer award winning Thai Cuisine!! Our selection of wine pairs wonderfully with Thai Cuisine with selection from all across the world we work hard to combine the very best selection of wine with our delicious food. Creating a lasting award winning experience is what we strive for everyday. Please join us tonight and see for yourself a true taste of Thailand.
Whether you're dining around our table or yours, make every occasion a special one. Visit our website to book your table or order takeout online.

And it puts Franchisees front-and-centre, because we know that a Franchisor can only set and support the "bar" - it's Franchisees that truly deliver the goods to Guests.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: We keep things simple. That's a big part of our business model. It's why we use a one-page menu. It's why our Culinary Development Program focuses on recipes with broad appeal, not "niche" menu items. And it's why we use similar design elements in all Socialhouses.

attributes.about_this_biz_history: In 1958, two brothers borrowed $600 from their mom to open a pizza place in Wichita, Kansas. They named it Pizza Hut because their sign only had room for eight letters. How profound! Soon, the restaurant grew. Why? The pizza was awesome. The service felt like home. And the customers were treated like family. And we've been delivering that same food and service ever since. For the Love of Pizza Since 1958. From day one, the Carney brothers could look their customers in the eye and promise them the finest pizza in town -- because they knew the farmers who grew the ingredients, and they knew those farmers cared about quality. Since then, our farmers have grown right alongside us, and the ingredients we use are still our highest priority. No one loves pizza more than Pizza Hut. That's why pizza is in our name -- and always will be.

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Sisters Jennie and Jessie Trakulthongroj have owned and operated the Pad Thai Restaurant in Pitt Meadows, BC since 1999.

Jennie and Jessie moved from their native Thailand to pursue their culinary and business educations. After school, they decided to immigrate permanently to Canada to build on their newly developed expertise and passion for authentic Thai Cuisine.

Pad Thai Restaurant has since developed into a mainstay dining establishment in Pitt Meadows with a loyal following and a dedicated staff.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
We offer several Thai dishes that have grown to become familiar in the West. Our Thai Curry excites your taste buds with a rich and fragrant curry of meats, poultry, shellfish, curry paste, fresh herbs and coconut milk while our Tom Yum Koong spices things up with hot Thai chilies, palm sugar, galangal, kaffir lime leaves and lemongrass.

Our house signature Pad Thai made of rice noodles stir fried with prawns, egg, peanut, pressed tofu, bean sprout, tamarind, sugar and spices will undoubtedly turn you into another regular patron of Pad Thai Restaurant.

name: Ban Chok Dee Thai Cuisine-Maple Ridge

about_this_biz_business_recommendation.description: Our other (original) location in Langley, BC!

attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
Owner and Executive Chef, Parinya, has been cooking Thai food from a very young age when she preapared meals for her family in Thailand and sold hot food on the street in front of her house. She has a passion and talent for Thai food, arts and culture and enjoyed sharing this with her friends and family. And now, she is able to share this passion with her customers at Ban Chok Dee Thai Cuisine. She can be seen running between the kitchen and the customers to make sure everything is just right!

She enjoys cooking, fruit and vegetable carving, decorating and flower arrangements, and loves to share these skills with others, whether it is through the dining experience at the restaurant; catering for a wedding or party; or directly through the cooking and carving classes that she offers.

In addition to Parinya, our current chefs all bring many years of experience cooking in the restaurants of Thailand and share Parinya's passion for food.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Ban Chok Dee Thai Cuisine opened in the summer of 2009 and is locally owned and operated. The owner, Parinya, moved to Canada from Thailand in 1998 and is committed to providing authentic, great tasting Thai food with traditional & friendly Thai service.

Starting out on 203 Street in Langley with 5 staff, we moved a new location on Douglas Crescent in Langley in the summer of 2012 and now have around 15 employees and seating for up to 120 guests.

In June 2016, we opened up a 2nd location in Maple Ridge offering the same great food and services.

We have been voted one of the Best Thai Restaurants in Langley since 2011 by the readers of the Langley Times and Langley Advance, and we were the first restaurant in Langley to have been awarded the Thai Select designation which is determined by the Thailand Department of International Trade Promotion.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: We offer award winning Thai Cuisine!! Our selection of wine pairs wonderfully with Thai Cuisine with selection from all across the world we work hard to combine the very best selection of wine with our delicious food. Creating a lasting award winning experience is what we strive for everyday. Please join us tonight and see for yourself a true taste of Thailand.

attributes.about_this_biz_history: Conceived over time and launched by Scotty Morison in 2004, the Browns Socialhouse Franchise concept was developed in light of a singular vision: to do more...with less. Browns Socialhouse wasn't developed through data analysis; it's real, experiential and intuitive. It's driven by extremely high expectations from the Franchisor, Browns Restaurant Group. And it puts Franchisees front-and-centre, because we know that a Franchisor can only set and support the "bar" - it's Franchisees that truly deliver the goods to Guests.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties: We keep things simple. That's a big part of our business model. It's why we use a one-page menu. It's why we stick to a "4-Walls" philosophy when it comes to building the Brand in local communities. It's why our Culinary Development Program focuses on recipes with broad appeal, not "niche" menu items. And it's why we use similar design elements in all Socialhouses.

attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Sisters Jennie and Jessie Trakulthongroj have owned and operated the Pad Thai Restaurant in Pitt Meadows, BC since 1999.

Jennie and Jessie moved from their native Thailand to pursue their culinary and business educations. After school, they decided to immigrate permanently to Canada to build on their newly developed expertise and passion for authentic Thai Cuisine.

Pad Thai Restaurant has since developed into a mainstay dining establishment in Pitt Meadows with a loyal following and a dedicated staff.
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
We offer several Thai dishes that have grown to become familiar in the West. Our Thai Curry excites your taste buds with a rich and fragrant curry of meats, poultry, shellfish, curry paste, fresh herbs and coconut milk while our Tom Yum Koong spices things up with hot Thai chilies, palm sugar, galangal, kaffir lime leaves and lemongrass.

Our house signature Pad Thai made of rice noodles stir fried with prawns, egg, peanut, pressed tofu, bean sprout, tamarind, sugar and spices will undoubtedly turn you into another regular patron of Pad Thai Restaurant.

attributes.about_this_biz_bio:
Your Place to Connect
To wave is a simple gesture which invites connection.
When was the last time you genuinely connected with something or someone? Chances are it was far too long ago. We set out to create a place where friends, family, and strangers could feel good coming together as a community. Waves Coffee invites you to connect with each other, a good cup of coffee, or something you've long forgotten. This is the sentiment and the origin behind our name.
attributes.about_this_biz_history:
Founded in 2005 at Hastings and Richards Street in downtown Vancouver, Waves has been blazing the trail for with superbly fresh brewed coffee, a commitment to local craftsmanship and community, and incomparable service.
In 2008, we were recognized by the Brand Coaches as the Hottest Brand in Canada. We have also been recognized as the Best of Brands by over 1,500 coffee retailers.
Today there are 38 Waves across British Columbia and Alberta and with more to come you'll be sure to ride the Waves with us sometime soon!
attributes.about_this_biz_specialties:
Your Place to Connect
To wave is a simple gesture which invites connection.
When was the last time you genuinely connected with something or someone? Chances are it was far too long ago. We set out to create a place where friends, family, and strangers could feel good coming together as a community. Waves Coffee invites you to connect with each other, a good cup of coffee, or something you've long forgotten. This is the sentiment and the origin behind our name.
At Waves, we take two things very seriously: coffee and chocolate. This is why we source and use only the best coffee beans available; 100% Specialty Grade beans purchased directly from small lot farmers. We blend our top quality coffee beans together with real Belgian chocolate (powder, be gone.) The result is a flavorful mocha that is second-to-none.
Waves is committed to providing a fresh and wide variety of sandwiches, wraps, soups and seasonal pastries. Pair our locally-sourced coffee and chocolate beverages with our fresh food menu for an elevated coffee-shop culinary experience.
Top it off with our unique set of offerings like a robust selection of rooibos drinks, free meeting rooms and consistently gracious team members. It's these elements and more that make Waves an intimate and locally-conscious answer to the replicated atmosphere of multinational coffee giants.

attributes.about_this_biz_history: In 1958, two brothers borrowed $600 from their mom to open a pizza place in Wichita, Kansas. They named it Pizza Hut because their sign only had room for eight letters. How profound! Soon, the restaurant grew. Why? The pizza was awesome. The service felt like home. And the customers were treated like family. And we've been delivering that same food and service ever since. For the Love of Pizza Since 1958. From day one, the Carney brothers could look their customers in the eye and promise them the finest pizza in town -- because they knew the farmers who grew the ingredients, and they knew those farmers cared about quality. Since then, our farmers have grown right alongside us, and the ingredients we use are still our highest priority. No one loves pizza more than Pizza Hut. That's why pizza is in our name -- and always will be.
